text: I'll be co-chairing TMA 2026 with Cigdem Sengul. Please submit your best measurement papers to TMA; see you in Delft, the Netherlands!
We will present RoVista+, our enhanced system for measuring RPKI ROV adoption on the Internet, at NANOG 96. We are currently developing a platform to disseminate our findings to the community.
I will present at NANOG 95 on our preliminary work using LLMs for dynamic ASN-to-organization mapping, integrating acquisition histories and subsidiaries beyond static BGP methods.
Hyeonmin Lee will be joining Hanyang University in South Korea as an assitant professor in March 2026. Hearty Congratulations!

I am always looking for motivated ph.d. students and postdocs. Please feel free to reach out to me. For a postdoc position, we have a funding opportunity at VT, called Virginia Tech Presidential Postdoctoral Fellowships.
Weitong received a travel grant from the IRTF to attend the IETF-123 meetings in Madrid, Spain.
My Ph.D. students, Hoang and Ishtiaq, will be working at Verisign and Facebook for their summer internship to work on DNSSEC and TLS.

NTIA published comments regarding the Reporting on Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Risk Mitigation Progress Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM). RoVista is used to measure the Route Origin Validation (ROV) status in the United States.
FCC recently proposed Internet Routing Security Reporting Requirements. In the accompanying fact sheet, RoVista is mentioned as an example approach for understanding ROV!
I am honored to be awarded the NSF CAREER Award; this proposal aims to enhance security protocols for Internet Routing and Naming.
I am honored to be awarded the Outstanding New Assistant Professor at the College of Engineering, Virginia Tech.
My Ph.D. student, Weitong, will be working at CableLabs for his summer internship to work on RPKI.
My Ph.D. student, Ishtiaq will be working at Meta for his summer internship to work on TLS and browser.
I gave a talk at NANOG 90 to present our RPKI study and RoVista
I am truly honored to be selected for the 2024 DNS-OARC Programme Committee.
RoVista is currently used by Internet Society Pulse for showing global RoV deployment.
Two Ph.D. students, Weitong and Protick will be working at ThousdandEyes and Cloudflare for their summer internship for RPKI and BGP research
I am excited and honored to be a <a href='https://www.manrs.org/champions/'>2023 Research Mentor at the Mutually Agreed Norms for Routing Security (MANRS), Internet Society<a>.
